results.title: Zea
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Leduc, Andre Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A superb visual trick that will mystify its audience, this animated film transforms the commonplace into magic. The film presented a serious technical challenge because the subject was both elusive and explosive. A film to watch, enjoy and laugh about. Film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Jacques Leduc, Andre Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Zazie Dans le Metro = Zazie in the Subway
results.brief_description:
Precocious, foul-mouthed pre-teen Zazie spends three days with her female impersonator uncle Gabriel in Paris with the sole intention of riding the Metro. But everything conspires against her.

Credits: Director, Louis Malle ; writers, Louis Malle, Jean-Paul Rappeneau ; photography, Henri Raichi ; music, Fiorenzo Carpi ; art direction, Bernard Evein.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Catherine Demongeot, Hubert Deschamps, Jacques Dufilho, Annie Fratellini.

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 2
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, and people and places which care for our health. This program looks at the dentis and doctor, hospitals and operations, ears and eyes, safety and environmental health and feelings. Finally, Zardip is able to attain the healthy wellness he had been seeking.

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 1
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, diet and nutrition, growth, the value of exercise and sleep, germs and how to take care of the teeth.

results.title: Zaa le Petit Chameau
results.brief_description:
Ali has new friend, a white camel called Zaa. But Zaa is kidnapped and taken to the market in Monastia (Algeria) to be sold. Narrated by Francois Perier.

Credits: Director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writer, Claude Roy ; photography, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Guy Bernard.
Cast: No cast information available.

results.title: Z00 = A Zed and Two Noughts
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Peter Sainsbury and Artificial Eye
results.brief_description: A bizarre meditation on the processes of life, death and decay, by that stylist of the off-beat and the grotesque, Peter Greenaway. Starring Joss Ackland, Brian Deacon, Eric Deacon, and Andrea Ferreol. “Very funny…very bizarre…beautiful, clever, dazzling.”

results.title: Z is for Zoo
results.creator_credit: Joan Horvath, Stelios Roccos and ACI Films
results.brief_description: Describes activities performed by animals in a zoo to introduce the words: walk, clean, eat, play and tail. Shows elephants, llamas, swans and monkeys.

results.title: Z cars. Episode 01.
results.brief_description: A compilation of three episodes from the popular BBC television series of the sixties and seventies about a special crime patrol set to combat the growing crime rate. Cast includes Brian Blessed, Stratford Johns, Frank Windsor, Joseph Brady, James Ellis and Jeremy Kemp. Written by Troy Kennedy Martin and Allan Prior.

results.title: Z = 'Z'
results.creator_credit: Costa Gavras, Jacques Perrin, Reganne Films and Valoria Films
results.brief_description: One of the most effective political thrillers ever filmed, “Z” is an account of an opposition MP (Yves Montand) of an unidentified Mediterranean country who is murdered before a national election. Jean-Louis Trintignant plays a magistrate whose investigation leads him to uncovering a secret organisation led by the military who are planning a coup-d’etat. Based on the situation in Greece which led to the military junta of 1966, Greek director Costas Gavras (who was in exile from the Greek Colonels) filmed this tense and exciting thriller in France and Algiers. On its release “Z” became an instant cause-celebre as its combination of melodrama, action and suspense elements made it incredibly effective anti-fascist propaganda. Whereas a film such as “Battle of Algiers” relied on approximation of realism to achieve its political goals, “Z” uses visceral and emotional manipulation to create a rollercoaster ride of a movie which aims to simulate the crisis of a democratic state falling to fascism. The film brought wide attention to the suffering of the Greek people under the junta as well as pointing out the cynical involvement of the CIA in supporting the undemocratic Colonels. With Irene Papas. The thrilling musical score by exiled composer Mikis Theodorakis was taken up by liberation movements throughout the world. Based on the book by Vassilis Vassilikos which was itself a roman-a-clef about the assassination of politician and journalist Lambrakis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Costa Gavras, Jacques Perrin, Reganne Films and Valoria Films

results.title: Yvonne's perfume = Le Parfum d'Yvonne [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Patrice Leconte, Thierry Ganay, M.G. Films, Centre European Cinematographique Rhones-Alpes, Zoulou Films and Lambart Productions
results.brief_description: 1958, a resort hotel on Lake Geneva is the setting for this foray into romance, friendship and decadence. It is at the hotel that Victor meets Dr. Meinthe, a flamboyant homosexual, and Yvonne, a beautiful woman who captures them both. Together, the three of them embark on a summer experience like no other. Cast includes Jean-Pierre Marielle, Hippolyte Girardot and Sandra Majani. In French with English subtitles.
